revised_title: Intrinsic Descending Spinal Tracts in Mammalian Cord: A Study on Fiber Systems
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments on dogs to study the descending intrinsic spinal tracts in the mammalian cord. They used a method of "successive degeneration" to identify and analyze the microscopic course of the channels involved. Their findings demonstrate the existence of abundant aborally-running fiber systems in various spinal segments, which they classified into four main categories: ventral short fibers, ventral long fibers, lateral short fibers, and lateral long fibers. These categories are essential for understanding the complex network of spinal cord communication and reflexes.
